organization.$: Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering
University of Texas at San Antonio One UTSA Circle

head.citation-title: 2D hexagonal quaternion Fourier transform in color image processing
head.abstracts: Â© 2016 SPIE.In this paper, we present a novel concept of the quaternion discrete Fourier transform on the two-dimensional hexagonal lattice, which we call the two-dimensional hexagonal quaternion discrete Fourier transform (2-D HQDFT). The concept of the right-side 2D HQDFT is described and the left-side 2-D HQDFT is similarly considered. To calculate the transform, the image on the hexagonal lattice is described in the tensor representation when the image is presented by a set of 1-D signals, or splitting-signals which can be separately processed in the frequency domain. The 2-D HQDFT can be calculated by a set of 1-D quaternion discrete Fourier transforms (QDFT) of the splitting-signals.

translated-sourcetitle.$: Proceedings of SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering

ref-info.ref-sourcetitle: Book Mobile Imaging for Healthcare Applications

affiliation.affilname: The University of Texas at San Antonio

coredata.dc:description: In this paper, we present a novel concept of the quaternion discrete Fourier transform on the two-dimensional hexagonal lattice, which we call the two-dimensional hexagonal quaternion discrete Fourier transform (2-D HQDFT). The concept of the right-side 2D HQDFT is described and the left-side 2-D HQDFT is similarly considered. To calculate the transform, the image on the hexagonal lattice is described in the tensor representation when the image is presented by a set of 1-D signals, or splitting-signals which can be separately processed in the frequency domain. The 2-D HQDFT can be calculated by a set of 1-D quaternion discrete Fourier transforms (QDFT) of the splitting-signals.
coredata.prism:publicationName: Proceedings of SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering
coredata.dc:title: 2D hexagonal quaternion Fourier transform in color image processing
